intro: Onosma calycina, commonly known as the Persian sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing a robust adaptation to dry conditions. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often with distinctive leaf shapes that aid in reducing water loss. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access groundwater in nutrient-poor soils. Onosma calycina is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal medicine.
